name: Path N GIST Stomach
title: Pathologic N
notes:
**Note 1**: Histological examination of a regional lymphadenectomy specimen will ordinarily include 16 or more lymph nodes. If the lymph nodes are negative, but the number ordinarily examined is not met, classify as pN0.

**Note 2:**  Code only regional nodes and nodes, NOS in this field.  Distant nodes are coded in distant metastasis.

**Note 3:**  Hepatoduodenal nodes are regional for primaries of the lesser curvature of the stomach.  They are coded in distant metastasis for all other subsites in this schema.

**Note 4:**  Regional lymph node involvement is rare for GISTs, so that cases in which the nodal status is not associated clinically or pathologically could be considered N0 instead of cNX or pNX.

**Regional lymph nodes for Stomach are:**

    Left gastric (superior gastric), NOS:
      Cardial
      Cardioesophageal
      Gastric, left
      Gastropancreatic, left
      Lesser curvature
      Lesser omental
      Paracardial
    Pancreaticosplenic (pancreaticolienal)
    Pancreaticoduodenal
    Perigastric, NOS
    Peripancreatic
    Right gastric (inferior gastric), NOS:
      Gastrocolic
      Gastroduodenal
      Gastroepiploic (gastro-omental), right or NOS
      Gastrohepatic
      Greater curvature
      Greater omental
      Pyloric, NOS: infrapyloric, subpyloric, suprapyloric
    Splenic (lienal), NOS:
    Gastroepiploic (gastro-omental), left
    Splenic hilar
    Nodule(s) in perigastric fat
    Celiac:
      Hepatic (excluding gastrohepatic) 
      Hepatoduodenal 
    For lesser curvature: hepatoduodenal
rows: Regional lymph nodes cannot be assessed

Surgical resection of primary and pathologic assessment of regional nodes are done but involvement of regional nodes not stated
Surgical resection of primary and pathologic assessment of regional nodes are done but involvement of regional nodes not documented in patient record

Nodule(s) or foci in pericolic fat/adjacent mesentery/mesocolic fat

Regional lymph nodes, NOS
Lymph nodes, NOS

Stated as N1
Clinically no nodes positive and no pathologic evaluation of nodes
In situ case as defined by TNM and there is a resection of the primary but the nodes are not evaluated pathologically
In situ case but no pTis is defined by TNM

No pathologic evaluation of regional lymph nodes and case is not in situ
Regional lymph node(s) cannot be assessed pathologically
No resection of a known primary (not T0)
No surgical resection of primary tumor and no positive biopsy of the highest N 
Unknown if any pathologic assessment performed
